title: Dragonblood vulnerabilities in WiFi WPA3 standard implementation
summary: Multiple vulnerabilities, referred to as Dragonblood, exist in WiFi WPA3 standard implementation .Dragonblood vulnerabilities impacting WiFi WPA3 standard implementations can cause password leak, denial of service or authorization bypass. They consist it:CVE-2019-9494: SAE cache attack against ECC groups (SAE side-channel attacks)CVE-2019-9495: EAP-PWD cache attack against ECC groups (EAP-PWD side-channel attack)CVE-2019-9496: SAE confirm missing state validationCVE-2019-9497: EAP-PWD reflection attack (EAP-PWD missing commit validation)CVE-2019-9498: EAP-PWD server missing commit validation for scalar/elementCVE-2019-9499: EAP-PWD peer missing commit validation for scalar/element

nodes.description: FortiOS: greater equal 6.2.0, less equal 6.2.1, fixed in [6.2.2]
